definition[0]: an amount of money that is paid to free someone who is held as a prisoner
example[0]: The kidnappers were demanding a ransom of $250,000.
example[1]: The government refused to pay the ransom.
example[3]: There has still been no ransom demand.
definition[1]: to pay an amount of money so that someone who is being held as a prisoner is set free
example[4]: They were all ransomed and returned unharmed.
